events.title: Explosion of the USS Maine
events.description: The USS Maine exploded in Havana Harbor, Cuba, killing 266 men. This event escalated tensions that led to the Spanish-American War.
events.significance: The sinking of the Maine inflamed US public opinion against Spain, serving as a catalyst for the war that expanded U.S. influence overseas.

events.title: Canada's New Flag Unveiled
events.description: Canada revealed its new national flag, featuring the maple leaf design, replacing the Red Ensign as the official flag.
events.significance: The new flag became a symbol of Canadian identity and unity, emphasizing a distinct national culture separate from colonial ties.

events.title: Global Day of Protest Against the Iraq War
events.description: Millions of people around the world participated in demonstrations opposing the impending invasion of Iraq by the United States and its allies.
events.significance: Represented one of the largest coordinated global protests in history, highlighting widespread public opposition to the Iraq War.

events.title: Washington Naval Treaty Signed
events.description: Major naval powers signed the Washington Naval Treaty to limit naval construction and prevent an arms race after World War I.
events.significance: Aimed at promoting peace and curbing militarization, it marked an important early 20th-century disarmament effort.
